problem: Find the remainder when $24^{50} - 15^{50}$ is divided by 13.
solution: We note that $24 \equiv -2 \pmod{13}$ and $15 \equiv 2 \pmod{13}$.  We cleverly use these congruences to set up values that vanish in the arithmetic: $$ 24^{50} - 15^{50} \equiv (-2)^{50} - 2^{50} \equiv 2^{50} - 2^{50} \equiv \boxed{0} \pmod{13}. $$
